latest.title: Notice of AGM
latest.content:
27 Jan 2026 07:00
RNS Number : 4210Q
Critical Metals PLC
27 January 2026
Critical Metals plc / EPIC: CRTM / Market: Main Market
27 January 2026
Critical Metals plc
("Critical Metals" or the "Company")
Notice of AGM
Critical Metals plc, a mining company established to acquire mining opportunities in the critical and strategic metals sector, currently developing the Molulu Copper/ Cobalt Project in the Democratic Republic of Congo ("DRC"), is pleased to inform shareholders of its Annual General Meeting which will be held at 10 am on 19 February 2026 at the offices of Hill Dickinson LLP, The Broadgate Tower, 20 Primrose Street, London, EC2A 2EW.
A copy of the Annual Report and Accounts for the year ended 30 June 2025, AGM Notice and Proxy Form are available by visiting the Company's website:
https://www.criticalmetals.co.uk/investors/corporate-documents
For further information contact:
Critical Metals plc
Danilo Lange, CEO
c/o
critical@stbridespartners.co.uk
St Brides Partners Ltd
Financial PR
Ana Ribeiro/Charlotte Page
critical@stbridespartners.co.uk
About Critical Metals
London-listed Critical Metals plc is focused on identifying low CAPEX and OPEX brown-field projects with near-term production and cash-flow, concentrating on minerals that have strategic importance to future global economic growth. In line with this, and with an off-take partner already in place, the Company is currently focused on recommencing production at the formerly producing Molulu Copper/Cobalt Project in the Katangan Copperbelt in Democratic Republic of Congo ('DRC').
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. latest.title: Issue of Convertible Loan Notes
latest.content:
31 Dec 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 2055N
Critical Metals PLC
31 December 2025
Critical Metals plc / EPIC: CRTM / Market: Main Market
31 December 2025
Critical Metals plc
("Critical Metals" or the "Company")
Issue of Convertible Loan Notes with related party participation to raise £2.1 million
Critical Metals plc (LSE:CRTM), a mining company established to acquire mining opportunities in the critical and strategic metals sector, currently developing the Molulu Copper/Cobalt Project ("Molulu") in the Democratic Republic of Congo, announces that it has issued a £2,100,000 convertible loan instrument ("CLN Instrument"). On 30 December 2025 NIU Invest SE ("NIU"), the majority shareholder in the Company, has agreed to subscribe to the full £2,100,000 of convertible loan notes ("CLNs") issued under the CLN Instrument at par.
The main terms of the CLNs are as follows:
·
Mature in 18 month;
·
Interest at 10% per annum, payable on maturity;
·
Are convertible into ordinary shares of the company at a conversion price of 10.25 per Ordinary Share of £0.0005 each in the capital of the Company ("Ordinary Shares"), which is equal to the 15 day volume weighted average share price and represents a 5.7% discount to the closing price on 29 December 2025; and
·
May be converted into shares at NIU's discretion at any time subject to certain restrictions and if not converted will be repayable at the end of the term.
The issue of the CLNs to NIU is a material related party transaction for the purposes of DTR 7.3.6 due to NIU's shareholding in the Company representing 74.04% of the issued Ordinary Shares.
The funds raised under the CLN will be used to carry out business development as the Company explores acquisition opportunities in the mining sector, fund exploration activities at Molulu and for general working capital.
Danilo Lange, Interim CEO of Critical Metals said:
"The £2.1 million raised through the CLN Instrument will enable the Company to start delivering on its strategy, funding exploration work at Molulu while also supporting the identification of potential acquisitions across the sector."
**ENDS**
For further information on the Company please visit
www.criticalmetals.co.uk
or contact:
Critical Metals plc
Danilo Lange, CEO
critical@stbridespartners.co.uk
St Brides Partners Ltd
Financial PR
Ana Ribeiro/Charlotte Page
critical@stbridespartners.co.uk
About Critical Metals
London listed Critical Metals plc is focused on identifying low CAPEX and OPEX brown-field projects with near-term production and cash-flow, concentrating on minerals that have strategic importance to future global economic growth. In line with this, and with an off-take partner already in place, the Company is currently focused on recommencing production at the formerly producing Molulu Copper/Cobalt Project in the Katangan Copperbelt in Democratic Republic of Congo ('DRC').

latest.title: Board Changes
latest.content:
16 Dec 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 6579L
Critical Metals PLC
16 December 2025
Critical Metals plc / EPIC: CRTM / Market: Main Market
16 December 2025
Critical Metals Plc
("Critical Metals" or the "Company")
Board Changes
Critical Metals plc (
LSE:CRTM)
, a mining company established to acquire mining opportunities in the critical and strategic metals sector, currently developing the Molulu Copper/Cobalt Project ("Molulu") in the Democratic Republic of Congo, announces two changes to the Board of Directors.
Mr Ali Farid Khwaja has resigned as Chief Executive Officer ("CEO"), effective immediately for personal reasons and the Board would like to thank him for his significant contributions during his short tenure as CEO, particularly in guiding the Company through a critical phase of restructuring. We wish him well for the future. The operations, financial plans and strategy remain unchanged. The Board is confident that the senior management can deliver the strategy and have the oversite and executive capability.
The Board has appointed Mr Danilo Lange as interim CEO of the Company while the Board carries out an executive search process in the coming months. The Board is confident that Mr Lange has the skills and experience to continue the company's development. Mr Lange is an experienced international executive with over 25 years of leadership experience across mining, consumer goods, and marketing sectors. He has a proven history in corporate turnaround, business expansion, and cross-cultural team management in Europe, the Middle East, and Eastern Europe. He previously served as CEO of a NASDAQ OMEX listed gold producer and exploration company in Sweden. He has held senior management roles at Serviceplan Group, Red Bull, and Yahoo! and is fluent in six languages, including French. He holds a Master of Science from the University of Applied Science & Economics, Germany.
**ENDS**
Critical Metals plc
critical@stbridespartners.co.uk
St Brides Partners Ltd
Financial PR
Ana Ribeiro / Charlotte Page
critical@stbridespartners.co.uk
About Critical Metals
Critical Metals plc (LSE: CRTM)
is
a mining company established to acquire and invest in brownfield mining projects with low-CAPEX and OPEX, close to production, in the critical and strategic metals sector. The Company
is focused in developing the formerly producing Molulu Copper/Cobalt Project in the Katangan Copperbelt in Democratic Republic of Congo. Its shares are admitted to the Official List and trade on the Main Market of the LSE.
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. company_30s.what_they_do: Critical Metals Plc extracts and supplies high‑grade metals used in batteries, wind turbines and other green‑tech applications.
company_30s.why_they_matter: The world is scrambling for critical metals to power decarbonisation, so a company that can supply them is a strategic asset for any portfolio.
company_30s.current_state: The firm is still pre‑revenue, heavily leveraged and has recently faced a trading suspension, indicating operational and liquidity distress.

rns_narrative: Capital‑raising and debt restructuring: The company issued convertible loan notes in December 2025 and extended their repayment date, while a share offer and subscription were completed in August. These moves suggest a desperate bid to shore up cash.

Governance turbulence: In September, NIU Invest increased its stake to almost 70 %, followed by a board reshuffle in December. The concentration of ownership and the rapid leadership changes raise concerns about strategic direction.

Trading halt and regulatory uncertainty: On 3 November 2025 the company was suspended from trading, a rare event for an AIM listing that signals either a technical glitch or a deeper compliance issue.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: Community engagement remains minimal; the few voices that exist are split between cautious hope for a debt‑relief turnaround and alarm over the trading halt and lack of revenue.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: Bulls point to the convertible notes as a potential catalyst for liquidity, arguing that a fresh capital injection could finally unlock a project pipeline and enable a revenue print.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bears warn that the trading suspension and the concentration of ownership by NIU Invest create a fragile governance environment, while the absence of any operating metrics keeps the company in a perpetual pre‑revenue state.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: Sentiment has remained flat; there was no noticeable surge in chatter after the CLN issue, and the community has not warmed to the latest AGM notice.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows zero search interest and flat momentum, while the ShareChat volume is nil. The story is losing oxygen – there is no external pressure to keep the narrative alive.

near_term_catalysts: Q1 2026 results: If the company reports any operational milestone or cost‑cutting progress, it could be a make‑or‑break moment for the bull case.
Potential regulatory update: Any resolution to the trading suspension or a compliance filing could restore market confidence.
expect_next.watch_for: Monitor for any director selling activity, a new trading halt, or a sudden spike in debt‑related disclosures. The bull case hinges on a revenue surprise; the absence of such a surprise will quickly erode any upside.
expect_next.timing_regime: Late – the technical score is low and the story is already exhausted. The best entry point would be after a clear catalyst, otherwise the risk is too high.
recent_past_catalysts: 27 January 2026 AGM: The board will decide on a new strategy, potential dilution, or a fresh capital raise. A clear action plan could revive the narrative.

buy_vs_sell.bull_case: If the AGM confirms a new project pipeline and a successful debt restructuring, the company could finally generate cash flow, turning the narrative from a liquidity story to a growth story. A revenue print in Q1 2026 would validate the bullish thesis.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: The trading suspension and lack of any operating metrics mean the company remains a pure speculation. Governance concentration and the absence of a clear project roadmap increase the risk of a further decline or even a delisting. Even if a new capital raise occurs, the dilution would erode shareholder value.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: High risk, low reward – the upside is capped at a modest premium if a revenue surprise materialises, while the downside could wipe out the entire position if the story fails to revive.

playbook.if_bullish: Enter a very small position (2–3 % of the portfolio) only if the AGM announces a concrete project launch or a favourable debt restructuring. Set a stop‑loss at 8 p, just below the last trading level.
playbook.if_watching: Hold off until the AGM or a Q1 2026 report provides tangible progress. Look for any sign of a revenue print or a credible cost‑cutting plan before committing.
playbook.if_passing: Stay out – the story is currently a textbook example of a distressed micro‑cap with no traction, a trading halt, and no revenue. Better opportunities exist elsewhere.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Pass – the company’s narrative is dead‑ended, the trading halt signals deeper problems, and there is no credible catalyst to justify a speculative bet.

reasons_to_sell.reason: Stale signal - not for active trading

trader_plan.profit_taking: Scale out into strength: 25% @ +15%, 50% @ +50%, trail runner

investor_plan.thesis_conditions: Unlock after AI triangulation + CONFIRMED timing

commentary.executive_summary: Note: this report used historical signals only — live triangulation (RNS, social, Trends) was not available. Current setup looks like CROWDED with an APEX score of 40/100. Historically there have been 1 rallies (avg. 463%); the position is now +463.4%. Practical take: this is interesting but unconfirmed — wait for an AI snapshot or clear confirmation before committing size.
bull_case: No obvious upside without a catalyst
bear_case: No immediate red flags, but keep stops tight
commentary.timing_translation: Late-stage rally — trim into strength and tighten risk.
commentary.confidence_explained: Confidence 40/100 — data triangulated from RNS, social and Trends.

data_quality.disclaimer: Data provided as-is. Not financial advice. AIM micro-caps carry significant volatility risk.
